alert.note: Alert for Coal; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central, southeast, and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc. In southeast Oklahoma, Coal. In southern Oklahoma, Murray. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM CDT, rain is decreasing across the advisory area, but flooding of low-lying and poorly drained areas may persist due to the heavy rain earlier today where between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one-quarter of an inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ada, Roff, Stonewall, Fitzhugh, Hickory, Fittstown and Jesse. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
